localize.text: Manager, you represent the company. I think your outfit is not up for the company standard.
I am only a Sephirah, so I can't do anything about it. Just saying.
I am Yesod, the Sephirah of the Information Team.
I am in charge of processing and archiving all the data of the company. We need to concentrate and focus on our job all the time.
Like the curators of a library.
A single mistake from us could cause a disaster.
I am sure you'd understand the gravity of my work.
Every bit of data we have... cost us blood and lives.
You should show some respect.
I am little allergic to... revealing cloths.
I hate revealing cloths.
I don’t know why or since when, though.
Probably before I got into the company.
Yesod, do you have some spare paper?
Netzach, you know the rules. We're not supposed to trade stuff between teams.
Pft, Yesod the Viper is not in a good mood.
I am leaving, okay?
Why, is this entertaining to you?
My apologies. I... overreacted a bit.
Other Sephirahs are just making fun of me.
But I know employees hate me.
I know my nickname is not a positive one.
But I like it, because I earned it on purpose.
It tells others who I am.
What do you think of my nickname?
I like it, too.
I don’t like it.
Then we're on the same page.
Well, I like it anyway.
I should go now.
I must finish today's work.
Oh, I will send you the next assignment.
You exceeded all my expectations.
Let me explain about your next-
Yesod! I heard about the accident.
How many times is it?
Shouldn't you... be with your team members?
Accidents do happen. I don't want to rub in it. It only encourages them to cry more.
But people are dead! You should say something, even a half-hearted commemorating speech would be better than silence!
I am not you. I see no point in being sentimental. I am too good to be shackled by cheap emotions.
Well, I am just saying... I guess there is no right answer. See you around!
What do you think? Should I go comfort them?
Yes, do so.
No, that's not necessary.
Honestly, I am surprised to hear that from you.
You make a speech every time there is an accident?
Don't you just watch them shred in pieces in your shiny monitor every day?
I will blame your inexperience, manager.
Sympathy does no good in the company.
Your gesture of 'good will' only fuels their frustration and anger.
You're not the one whose life is on the line.
You don't know how it feels when every moment could be your last.
They're so close to death that they do not have hopes for a brighter future.
I don't like the way Hod copes with it. She just shuts eyes and as if nothing happened.
Me, I work hard to find ways to minimize casualties.
Z... umm. Zoo.
Oz!
Oz is an imaginary place! It doesn't count.
Oops, I didn't know you were there, Sephirah.
Sorry, I didn't mean to... He insisted...
What? You started it, you wanted revenge, remember?
Shut it, Dirk!
Go back to your work, now!
Of course, Sephirah. We're sorry!
Word chain is one of the most popular pastime here.
Do you like the game?
(Yesod ponders.)
James, you can’t enter the cell when your stress level is above 80%. It's against rules.
I know, just this once, please? You know Sally went in at 82% and came out fine! I need this run to meet the quota.
What are friends for, huh? You know I am on your side no matter what.
I promise you, just this once.
You know, I am not in the position to make exceptions...
What's the problem if no one knows? Besides, I gave you some slack yesterday when we were playing word chain.
Fine, but only this once.
And make sure to take the examination after the work.
Sure! Thanks, Yesod! You just saved my life!
Sometimes I see hallucination when I change my clothes.
My skin... is covered with festering boils... horrible.
Of course, my body is fine when I open my eyes.
What bothers me is... not the hallucination itself.
It's that feeling... that the hallucination is real and I am deluding myself into believing that I have normal skin...
I asked other Sephirahs, but I am the only one who experiences this.
James purposefully released two Abnormalities that eventually killed seven people.
Lost the Abnormalities and four employees.
I ordered to shoot down James.
I know what kind of place we're working in.
I am not sorry for the fact that I was unable to stop him.
I am sorry for the fact that I knew him personally.
I let my subordinates exploit me.
The chat, the game, all fun.
And James was a good joker.
Playing word chain was fun, too.
James died because I was weak.
I promised myself not to repeat this error on that day.
Manager, this is Lobotomy Corporation.
We see body bags every day.
It's a lonely place.
Sometimes you will want to have friends.
When you feel lonely, remember what happened to me.
You will be able to get over meaningless deaths.
I envy Angela. She doesn’t have feelings.
People say I am too rational.
They say I am cold-blooded, calculating, and devoid of emotions. I take them as compliments.
I am not in denial, you know.
Whoever built this place is a cruel person.
Sometimes, I want to be an AI without emotion...
Sympathy clouds your judgment. You are bound to make mistakes.
Why would anyone place AI with emotion in this cruel facility?
Do you know the answer?
Yesod, you feel nothing about this?
Try drinking some Enkephalin, close your eyes, and open again.
I am glad you are not as weak as the other Sephirahs. It is important to keep a clear head in any situation.
….... Gabriel, why are you scratching yourself like that?
Seeing as we've met again, you must have completed your tasks, manager.
I'd give you a compliment if I didn't have so much work to do.
The Information Team has a work that they must do on specific periods.
You must have realized there are some blanks on the Abnormality Records.
Among the tremendous amount of information we gather, there are some that are off limits to the employees for security reasons.
The names of the employees are one of those information.
All traces of them, what happened to them, their gruesome deaths, their desperate will to live, all of that has been stripped from the records under the pretext of "expunging information."
I do not know what the criteria are for stripping the records. That is decided by other departments, not us.
We only manipulate the information we receive, per ordered.
Isn’t it funny?
What we do is destroy or manipulate information, but somehow we are still called the "Information Team."
Whenever I am introduced as a Sephirah of the Information Team,
I sometimes feel something bubbling up inside me.
Yesod, did you receive the documents to expunge?
You will get the employee list soon as well. Don't forget to be reviewed after you finish expunging the documents.
Angela, what do you think it means to remember someone’s name?
Why are you so emotional today?
Maybe names are like marks for atypical existences to distinguish themselves from others.
Someone might have named you Angela having the same thought.
Yesod, if you are too tired, take a break.
I knew you would say that.
I’m glad you know.
Calling employees with their names is not recommended here.
When employees enter the company, each one receives their own identification number.
This is to allow the company to identify the minimum necessary information.
We have their numbers in our data storage device.
Malkuth did not call employees by their names from the beginning.
Maybe she is the most ideal Sephirah amongst us all.
I am not saying that it is appropriate for Malkuth to take all the pain as well.
None of us do.
What kind of bad taste is that, to lock us into the metal body, and to make us repeat our days endlessly?
I'm talking to you. What's with that blank expression?
I heard you might be one of our designers.
The only thing I could do here is remember a few names of the forgotten employees, and despair endlessly...
Feeling sick of even a single breath of air...
Are you having fun watching your guinea pigs?
See, I told you, the inside has been rotting for a long time...
Gabriel was more rational than anyone else.
He was unmoved, even after listening to what happened to Elijah.
Some said he lacked empathy.
But nobody knew he was festering in the inside.
Maybe it started happening from long ago, ever since Carmen the world.
He slowly became expressionless. He did not allow himself to even have paltry joys.
He also could not stand having even a small part of his body being exposed.
We made a monster that was not supposed to exist in this world. We came too far to go back.
To not let what Elijah did go to vain, instead of taking time to grieve, everyone knew they needed to utilize this result to the fullest.
He tried to remain level-headed, but his attempts became an obsession.
He started to wear long sleeved shirts that also covered his neck. Not much later, he started to scratch himself harshly.
We suggested he receive a check-up to see whether he was contaminated or infected, but he refused.
Enforce.
Enforce.
Enforce.
Health check-ups were needed to prevent further damage. Persuasion became compulsion, and compulsion led to the use of physical force.
He was tied up for the check up, but resisted so violently that It was hard for us to watch him.
Eventually, it turned out that he was not infected at all.
But was that really fortunate?
No, it was not. He didn’t get any better. He kept scratching himself. So badly.. Even worse..
When I saw him last, he was not cognizant to what anyone said, and his body was covered in scratches.
No body has seen him since then.
.... I heard about Elijah, I’m sorry.
I guess now everybody knows there are consequences when forcefully opening an access-controlled laboratory.
Also, you were very careless not to put the supply room key back to its place.
You may think I am being too strict, but I can’t help it. I am not saying anything wrong.
I should set up a time for when keys must be returned to prevent this from happening again.
I wore this to prevent chemicals from splashing on my body.
I am just a little tired.
Never mind. I will go prepare the next experiment.
Wounds have a way of showing; even for those who wish to keep them concealed.
For Gabriel, it was his clothes.
Maybe he felt better to conclude that Elijah’s death was caused by not following the rules.
He tried harder to stick to principles. He tried to maintain his objectivity.
But perhaps his excessive rationality is what destroyed him.
His earnest hope to not to see anyone else die did not come true.
No, I don’t want to lie anymore. I pretended that I didn’t hear the shout of desperation.
No need to ask me if I am doing okay.
I heard about what you and I did.
It was the first time for me to lose myself.
It was not pleasant, but it was not as terrible as I expected it to be.
I rather feel relieved.
I am not saying all the hatred I have is gone.
I will still see the rotting illusion, sometimes feel disgusted, and will feel unbearable anger towards you.
Well, there is one aspect that's changed.
I can be in as much despair as I want to now.
Someday, painful hope will grow out of the rotten wound.
What you gave to us was a seed of hope.
I think you are also on your way to embracing your past.
It's always the beginning that's difficult.
And your outfit is still not acceptable.
I should seriously consider having penalty points even for managers.
